instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b..no display
threads.message: hi..i have a macbiik pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ..part no is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b...before it was working everything is ok...but accidently i remove the lcd cable(on working condition)......after that there is no display on screen...but iam sure external display is ok...already i check another same display...still same...plz give me a solution

threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at both pins of <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.message:
Don't write ohm, for diode mode readings.
0.500 ohm is same as 0.5 ohm which is pure short in fact.

Post <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM levels.

threads.message:
Backlight is not even enable, don't waste time in that area.

Can you detect image, using a flashlight from behind?
Actually get external video for sure?
Can you confirm USB activity?

threads.message: this one ready sir.....this is lvds connector problm.....inside burn...( i think when i remove the lvds cable without unplug the power..thats why damage the connector...thank u for your support...
